name: Bobby Brown
venue: The North Door (501 Brushy St, Austin, TX 78702)
title: Houdini: Future of CSS?
description: The Houdini Task Force, which I introduced at last year's SassConf, is rolling along nicely. Several aspects of making CSS customizable now have draft specs, and are maturing nicely. There are even experimental builds in browsers! This talk will give a quick introduction to Houdini for those who are new, describe the parts that are reaching maturity, and hint at those that are still a bit far off.

name: Janet Jacks
venue: Retail Me Not (301 Congress Ave #700, Austin, TX 78701) - Boardroom
title: Getting Sassy with CSS
description: I don't know about you, but vanilla CSS always leaves me wanting more.  It's a fairly simple language, can do some pretty powerful things, but after a while.. well, it can become rather tedious to work with.  Enter Sass: Syntactically Awesome Stylesheets.  Sass is a CSS meta-language and precompiler that makes the prettification of your website a breeze by adding invaluable features of more traditional programming languages.  In this workshop, we'll jump right in to the Sass workflow and cover all the key game changers - nesting, variables, mixins, inheritance, and directives.  We'll also cover some of the gotchyas, tools and extensions, and tips on organization and coding standards.
bio: Janet is a frontend developer working remotely out of NYC for a company called Base. name: Maria Smith
venue: Funsize (407B E 6th St #204, Austin, TX 78701) - Large Room
title: Why CSS is Horrible
description: The web is more than a technology platform — it was created with a mission statement, and a clear philosophy of inclusive diversity. One web, for everyone, from any device, with control in the hands of users. Design, code, and management trends also come with attached philosophies — and they’re not always so friendly. What do we believe about diversity, and how is it reflected in our code, our companies, clients, products, and processes?
bio: Maria Smith is an author, performer, musician, designer, and web developer.
